author: Special Correspondent
text:
They want relaxation in norms relating to carrying cash

Representatives from Tamil Film Producers Council met Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni on Tuesday urging him to look into some of the issues faced by them and requested exemption from the norm relating to carrying cash which was to be used for shooting films. “As the Model Code of Conduct is in place, movement of money is being restricted. Since we are involved in shooting films, we requested the Election Commission to give exemption and allow Rs. 2 lakh to Rs. 5 lakh for small films and Rs. 5 lakh to Rs.10 lakh for big films,” TFPC president ‘Kalaipuli’ S. Thanu said. He also sought the Commission to allow the exemption given by the government on entertainment tax for films that have been certified as ‘U’. “The MCC should not affect this,” he said. Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said he would look into the issues. Since the Model Code of Conduct came into force on March 4, about 800 complaints have been received by the Commission alleging violations by parties and individuals.

They demand permission to carry Rs. 2 lakh to Rs.10 lakh in cash for shooting films
title: Relax norms on carrying cash, film producers urge EC
